Authors: Vivi Oktavianis Efendi, Gayuh Rahayu, iman - hidayat
Title:
Phenotypic and Phylogenetic study of Some Trichoderma Species
from Indonesian Soil and Litters
Abstract:
Phenotypic and phylogenetic analyses of 27 Trichoderma
isolates deposited at LIPIMC and IPBCC have been carried out. Single and
GCPSR approach using sequence of ITS (Internal Transcribed Spacer) and
Translation elongation factor 1alpha encoding (tef1) genes region were
applied. Phenotypically, these isolates distributed into three sections
of Trichoderma, i.e. Longibrachiatum, Pachybasidium and Trichoderma
which was supported by the phylogenetic studies. Phylogenetic analyses
of either single gene or GCPSR approach indicated that 25 isolates can
be validly named into species level, however, two other isolates still
needed further investigation using other Trichoderma barcode i.e. RNA
polymerase II gene (RPB2). Of the 25 isolates, eleven isolates
determined as T. harzianum, 5 isolates were T. tawa, three isolates each
determined as T. reseei and T. virens, and the remaining isolates each
belong to either T. asperellum, T. atroviride or T. ovalisporum. No
strains found being subtrate specific.
